game

Class Freecell

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Freecell

  • public class Freecell
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple Freecell card game using java
    See Also:
    Board, OrderedStack

    • Method Detail

      • command

        public static void command(Board b1)
        Prompt, check and process input command from user Method to prompt input from user and check if they are valid command. Proceeds by processing the command if is valid.
        Parameters:
        b1 - Game board

      • checkToFrom

        public static boolean checkToFrom(Board b1,
                                  java.lang.String from,
                                  java.lang.String to)
        Check source and destination Returns true only if source and destination of card movement is valid. Source can only be from column 1 to column 9. Nothing can be move from any pile. Destination should be valid pile or column.
        Parameters:
        b1 - Game board
        from - Source of card movement
        to - Destination of card movement
        Returns:
        true if source is from column 1 to column 9 or column is empty

      • checkMultMove

        public static boolean checkMultMove(Board b1,
                                    char from,
                                    char to,
                                    int searchIndex)
        Check if multiple cards movement follows rules Check if deck of cards starting from the specified card is one points larger than the next card or when destination column is empty.
        Parameters:
        b1 - Game board
        from - Source of card movement
        to - Destination of card movement
        searchIndex - 1-based position where an specified card is on source stack
        Returns:
        true if deck of cards follows order or destination column is empty

      • move

        public static void move(Board b1,
                        java.lang.String from,
                        java.lang.String to)
        Move last card from source stack to destination stack Method moves the last card from source column to destination if the points of card is one point smaller and the suit matches the pile's suit when destination is a pile. When destination is a column.
        Parameters:
        b1 - Game board
        from - Source of card movement
        to - Destination of card movement

      • move

        public static void move(Board b1,
                        java.lang.String from,
                        java.lang.String whatCard,
                        java.lang.String to)
        Move deck of cards from source stack to destination stack Method moves the deck of cards starting from the specified card till the end of the stack if the rules is followed. IfWhen destination is pile, deck of cards is reversed to add into pile if they follows rules
        Parameters:
        b1 - Game board
        from - Source of card movement
        whatCard - Specific card starting to move from
        to - Destination of card movement

      • colRotate

        public static void colRotate(Board b1,
                             java.lang.String col)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                             java.util.EmptyStackException
        Rotate column Remove last card and insert into the top of the stack
        Parameters:
        b1 - Game board
        col - Column to be rotated
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Invalid or inpropriate input is entered without folloring the rules.
        java.util.EmptyStackException - Stack is empty

        public static boolean isElementOfCards(Board b1,
                                       java.lang.String card)
        Check card's validity Check if card is a valid card
        Parameters:
        b1 - Game board
        card - card's face
        Returns:

      • checkGameOver

        public static void checkGameOver(Board b1)
        Exit if game is completed Check if every pile is filled with 12 cards. If yes, the game will end.
        Parameters:
        b1 - Game board
